result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

offer to settle

Defendant Christopher D. Boyd in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF170,16Cf179,16CF202,16CM67,16CM98,16CM116. DA comments there is an agreement.  Needs to waive prelim hearing in all felony cases. no threat or force to waive prelim. Know and vol gives up right to prelim. Ct finds in each case def has know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds prob cause def committed fel in Ashland Co. cases now bound over for argn. Offer to settle from 10/11/16. is the agreement. Pleas NC to all counts 
and 16CM98 DRI. 16CF106 DRi cts 2,4. 16CF170 DRI counts 2,4,5,6. 16CF1791-4 DRI. 16CF02 Counts 2,4-5 DRI. Def signed plea Questionaire. Understands charges. Understands the elements of the crimes. Wants ct to accept pleas of NC. Ct finds pleas on NC have been know and vol given. Accepts pleas and Finds G. State complied with Vic rights. 16CF170,16Cf106,16Cm116,16Cm67 are vic rights notification. 16Cm67 claim from walmart on Rest. from the referral. DA comments that prior record. Atty would like the sentence to be the agreement. cancel commit. set current payplan @ 25 a month,
